title: Tier X stats
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought at tier X during update 6.0.
Battles per Player Number of battles fought per player during the update 6.0.
On average, players played 127 battles. Median was 53 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.0 was 16694 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per Player table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.0 by the X% most inactive players. A reading tip: 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.
  Show table      % of Players Battles during the update     0% 1   10% 3   25% 13   50% 53   75% 160   90% 333   100% 16694      Player WR distribution The following graph shows a histogram of players (y-axis) with certain WR during the update 6.0 (x-axis). This graph includes all the players who have played during the update, even a single game. Therefore there are peaks around 25%, 33%, 50%, 67% and 75% and players with 0% or 100% WR
Share of Battles per Nation per Vehicle Class This chart shows share of battles per nation per vehicle class at tier X.

title: Tier X Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.0 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier X Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.1 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier X Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.4 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier X Tanks

  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.7 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier X Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.8 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: BlitzAnalysiz()
content:
BlitzAnalysiz() Welcome to BitzAnalysiz(), a site about in-depth analysis of World of Tanks Blitz game statistics. Here you can find data-backed answers to questions like:
 “What are the strongest tanks in the game - tier-for tier?" “What is the most played tank in the game?" “How is players’ WR distributed over the tiers?".  Stats for the latest update	Highest performing tanks	Most played tanks	Total battles by players	Latest posts  2020-06-17 Update 6.10 stats added   2020-06-08 Measuring tank performance   2020-05-16 Stats since update 6.0 added   2020-05-07 BlitzAnalysiz.com launched   Other great WoT Blitz sites  The Official WoT Blitz game site by Wargaming BlitzStars - Player statistics BlitzStars Tank Compare - Tank comparison tool Blitz Hangar - Tank knowledge base WoTinspector.com - Tank armor analysis, Replays, Map inspector and more

title: Tank stats
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows tanks with the highest average of players’ WR in the tank compared to the players’ WR at the same tier (in all tanks). This is a measure of the performance of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.0 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. Player WR denotes the tank’s players’ average WR across all the tanks during the update.
  Details    Only battles in maxed-out tanks are taken into account. It is assumed that a tank is maxed out if it is a) premium tank or b) player has more than certain number of battles in it in the end of the update (tier dependent: Tier I: 0 battles, Tier X: 152 battles. Since the data is fetched once per update, the stats for just released new Tech-Tree tanks is lower than it should be since the battles players ground the tanks from stock are included in the average. On the other hand new high tier tanks are often ground first by more active and also better players that distorts the average WR. Only tanks with more than 50 players are listed. This may filter out few upcoming tanks that are being tested.    Highest Average WR - Table Average WR denotes average WR in a tank accross all the players during the update. III 1.8 54.8 847 45274 Researchable 53.0   AMX M4 mle. 49 1.8 57.0 639 40848 Premium 55.2      Highest Average WR This graph shows the tanks with the highest average WR during update 6.1. Player WR denotes the tank’s players’ average WR across all the tanks during the update.
  Details    Only battles in maxed-out tanks are taken into account. It is assumed that a tank is maxed out if it is a) premium tank or b) player has more than certain number of battles in it in the end of the update (tier dependent: Tier I: 0 battles, Tier X: 152 battles. Since the data is fetched once per update, the stats for just released new Tech-Tree tanks is lower than it should be since the battles players ground the tanks from stock are included in the average. On the other hand new high tier tanks are often ground first by more active and also better players that distorts the average WR. Only tanks with more than 50 players are listed. This may filter out few upcoming tanks that are being tested.    Highest Average WR - Table Average WR denotes average WR in a tank accross all the players during the update. title: Tank stats
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows tanks with the highest average of players’ WR in the tank compared to the players’ WR at the same tier (in all tanks). This is a measure of the performance of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.10 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. Player WR denotes the tank’s players’ average WR across all the tanks during the update.
  Details    Only battles in maxed-out tanks are taken into account. It is assumed that a tank is maxed out if it is a) premium tank or b) player has more than certain number of battles in it in the end of the update (tier dependent: Tier I: 0 battles, Tier X: 152 battles. Since the data is fetched once per update, the stats for just released new Tech-Tree tanks is lower than it should be since the battles players ground the tanks from stock are included in the average. On the other hand new high tier tanks are often ground first by more active and also better players that distorts the average WR. Only tanks with more than 50 players are listed. This may filter out few upcoming tanks that are being tested.    Highest Average WR - Table Average WR denotes average WR in a tank accross all the players during the update. title: Tank stats
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows tanks with the highest average of players’ WR in the tank compared to the players’ WR at the same tier (in all tanks). This is a measure of the performance of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.2 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks.   Details    Only battles in maxed-out tanks are taken into account. It is assumed that a tank is maxed out if it is a) premium tank or b) player has more than certain number of battles in it in the end of the update (tier dependent: Tier I: 0 battles, Tier X: 152 battles. Since the data is fetched once per update, the stats for just released new Tech-Tree tanks is lower than it should be since the battles players ground the tanks from stock are included in the average. On the other hand new high tier tanks are often ground first by more active and also better players that distorts the average WR. Only tanks with more than 50 players are listed. This may filter out few upcoming tanks that are being tested.    Highest Average WR - Table Average WR denotes average WR in a tank accross all the players during the update. Player WR denotes the tank’s players’ average WR across all the tanks during the update.
  Details    Only battles in maxed-out tanks are taken into account. It is assumed that a tank is maxed out if it is a) premium tank or b) player has more than certain number of battles in it in the end of the update (tier dependent: Tier I: 0 battles, Tier X: 152 battles. Since the data is fetched once per update, the stats for just released new Tech-Tree tanks is lower than it should be since the battles players ground the tanks from stock are included in the average. On the other hand new high tier tanks are often ground first by more active and also better players that distorts the average WR. Only tanks with more than 50 players are listed. This may filter out few upcoming tanks that are being tested.    Highest Average WR - Table Average WR denotes average WR in a tank accross all the players during the update. title: Tank stats
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows tanks with the highest average of players’ WR in the tank compared to the players’ WR at the same tier (in all tanks). This is a measure of the performance of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.5 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. Player WR denotes the tank’s players’ average WR across all the tanks during the update.
  Details    Only battles in maxed-out tanks are taken into account. It is assumed that a tank is maxed out if it is a) premium tank or b) player has more than certain number of battles in it in the end of the update (tier dependent: Tier I: 0 battles, Tier X: 152 battles. Since the data is fetched once per update, the stats for just released new Tech-Tree tanks is lower than it should be since the battles players ground the tanks from stock are included in the average. On the other hand new high tier tanks are often ground first by more active and also better players that distorts the average WR. Only tanks with more than 50 players are listed. This may filter out few upcoming tanks that are being tested.    Highest Average WR - Table Average WR denotes average WR in a tank accross all the players during the update. title: Tank stats
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows tanks with the highest average of players’ WR in the tank compared to the players’ WR at the same tier (in all tanks). This is a measure of the performance of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.6 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. Player WR denotes the tank’s players’ average WR across all the tanks during the update.
  Details    Only battles in maxed-out tanks are taken into account. It is assumed that a tank is maxed out if it is a) premium tank or b) player has more than certain number of battles in it in the end of the update (tier dependent: Tier I: 0 battles, Tier X: 152 battles. Since the data is fetched once per update, the stats for just released new Tech-Tree tanks is lower than it should be since the battles players ground the tanks from stock are included in the average. On the other hand new high tier tanks are often ground first by more active and also better players that distorts the average WR. Only tanks with more than 50 players are listed. This may filter out few upcoming tanks that are being tested.    Highest Average WR - Table Average WR denotes average WR in a tank accross all the players during the update. title: Tank stats

  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.8 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. Player WR denotes the tank’s players’ average WR across all the tanks during the update.
  Details    Only battles in maxed-out tanks are taken into account. It is assumed that a tank is maxed out if it is a) premium tank or b) player has more than certain number of battles in it in the end of the update (tier dependent: Tier I: 0 battles, Tier X: 152 battles. Since the data is fetched once per update, the stats for just released new Tech-Tree tanks is lower than it should be since the battles players ground the tanks from stock are included in the average. On the other hand new high tier tanks are often ground first by more active and also better players that distorts the average WR. Only tanks with more than 50 players are listed. This may filter out few upcoming tanks that are being tested.    Highest Average WR - Table Average WR denotes average WR in a tank accross all the players during the update. title: Tank stats
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows tanks with the highest average of players’ WR in the tank compared to the players’ WR at the same tier (in all tanks). This is a measure of the performance of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.9 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. Player WR denotes the tank’s players’ average WR across all the tanks during the update.
  Details    Only battles in maxed-out tanks are taken into account. It is assumed that a tank is maxed out if it is a) premium tank or b) player has more than certain number of battles in it in the end of the update (tier dependent: Tier I: 0 battles, Tier X: 152 battles. Since the data is fetched once per update, the stats for just released new Tech-Tree tanks is lower than it should be since the battles players ground the tanks from stock are included in the average. On the other hand new high tier tanks are often ground first by more active and also better players that distorts the average WR. Only tanks with more than 50 players are listed. This may filter out few upcoming tanks that are being tested.    Highest Average WR - Table Average WR denotes average WR in a tank accross all the players during the update. title: Update 6.10
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought during 6.10. All the stats (WR, damage, battles, etc.) refer to stats during the update, not cumululative/total/lifetime stats unless otherwise mentioned. In total, there were 196650865 battles recorded by 402435 players.
Battles per Player The graph shows the number of battles fought per player during the update 6.10. On average, players played 489 battles. Median was 281 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.10 was 9995 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per Player - Table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.10 by the X% most inactive players. Reading tip 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.

title: Tier IX Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.0 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier IX Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.1 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier IX Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.10 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier IX Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.5 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier IX Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.9 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Stats by tier
content:
This page shows player statistics per tier played during update 6.0. Tank statistics per tier can be found here.
Average Tier WR vs. Average Tier This graph shows player WR vs. average tier during the update 6.0. Minimum 100 battles required.
Share of Players per WR per Tier This chart shows share of players with certain WR (bar color-code) at certain tier (x-axis). The graph considers only battles with maxed-out tanks and players with minimum number of battles at the tier (10-30 depending on the tier). Each players battles at different tiers have been taken into account.
Number of Battles per Tier Share of Battles per Tank Type per Tier This chart shows share of battles fought at tier with with particular tank type during update 6.0. The width of the bar shows the share of battles in that tier’s tanks out of total number of battles in the dataset (85237844).
Share of Battles per Nation per Tier This chart shows share of battles fought at tier per tank nation during update 6.0. The width of the bar shows the share of battles in that tier’s tanks out of total number of battles in the dataset (85237844).
Share of Battles per Nation per Tank Type This chart shows share of battles fought per tank nation åer tank type during update 6.0. The width of the bar shows the share of battles in that nation’s tanks out of total number of battles in the dataset (85237844).

content:

Statistics by Blitz update  Update 6.10   Update 6.9   Update 6.8   Update 6.7   Update 6.6   Update 6.5   Update 6.4   Update 6.3   Update 6.2   Update 6.1   Update 6.0   The statistics are being updated at the end of every update so those lag behind one update.

title: Update 6.9
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought during 6.9. All the stats (WR, damage, battles, etc.) refer to stats during the update, not cumululative/total/lifetime stats unless otherwise mentioned. In total, there were 136633758 battles recorded by 355985 players.
Battles per Player The graph shows the number of battles fought per player during the update 6.9. On average, players played 384 battles. Median was 236 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.9 was 7230 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per Player - Table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.9 by the X% most inactive players. Reading tip 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.
  Show table      % of Players Battles during the update     10% 8   25% 50   50% 236   75% 562   90% 959   100% 7230      Player WR Distribution The graph shows WR distribution for players (y-axis) with during the update 6.9 (x-axis). Only players with more than 100 battles are included.
From the unfiltered WR histogram one can see the bumbs at 0%, 25%, 33%, 50%, 67% 75% and 100% due to large number of of players who played only few battles during the update.

More Statistics by Tier here.
Players by Region This graphs shows players by region in the dataset who have played at least one game. More Statistics by region here. Please note, this does not mean all the players per server, but just those who have been recorded in the BlitzAnalysiz database.
 Tanks with the Highest WR This graph shows the tanks with the highest average WR during update 6.9. Player WR denotes the tank’s players’ average WR across all the tanks during the update. Only tanks with more than 50 players are listed. This may filter out few upcoming tanks that are being tested. More Tank Statistics here.

title: Tier VIII Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.0 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier VIII Tanks

  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.10 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks.   Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.2 only. The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier VIII Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.3 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier VIII Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.4 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier VIII Tanks
content:

  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.6 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier VIII Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.8 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. Relative WR is a measure of the performance of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.9 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Blog
content:
2020-06-17 Update 6.10 stats added  Stats for update 6.10 has been added to the site. How did the ATGM tanks actually perform? Did Sheridan deserve its nerf in 7.10? Was T92E1 still one of the best performing tier IX tanks?
 2020-06-08 Measuring tank performance  Updated 2020-06-17 Over-Powered (OP) tanks are maybe the 2nd most popular topic on Blitz YouTube videos and online chats - right after “the Matchmaker”. I have long held the view that if a tank is “OP”, this has to be visible in statistics.
 2020-05-16 Stats since update 6.0 added  I have been busy cleaning up the codebase and fixing tons of little issues. Here are main updates: Stats since update 6.0 I have added stats for updates since 6.0 to the site.
 2020-05-07 BlitzAnalysiz.com launched  Hy!
BlitzAnalysiz.com is a site about in-depth game statistics of Wargaming’s World of Tanks Blitz. You won’t find individial player statistics here - for those, please check awesome Blitzstars.com. Instead, the the site is about analysis of the player population and tank performance statistics.

title: Tier VII Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.0 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier VII Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.10 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier VII Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.2 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier VII Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.5 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier VII Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.6 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. title: Tier VII Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.9 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Stats by Region
content:
This page shows statistics per Blitz servers/regions (EU, NA, ASIA, Russia) during update 6.0. Statistics for the Chinese server are not available via WG API.
Number of players This graphs shows players by region in the dataset who have played at least one game. Please note, this does not mean all the players per server, but just those who have been recorded in the BlitzAnalysiz database.
WR Distribution This graph shows players’ overall WR distribution during update 6.0 on diferent regions.
These graphs cannot be used to say anything about the skill-level differences between the servers. Instead, the graphs tell more about the player sampling per server. BlitzAnalysiz() database has relatively more players from EU and NA (com) servers vs. RU and Asia servers. In all the servers the players sampled are on average more active and better than the true player average due to the way how the player account_ids are being harvested.
 Cumulative distribution function This graphs shows the same information than the previous in different format. The curve tells how large share of players (y-axis) had WR less than (x-axis) during update 6.0.

title: Update 6.7
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought during 6.7. All the stats (WR, damage, battles, etc.) refer to stats during the update, not cumululative/total/lifetime stats unless otherwise mentioned. In total, there were 126377371 battles recorded by 329556 players.
Battles per Player The graph shows the number of battles fought per player during the update 6.7. On average, players played 383 battles. Median was 232 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.7 was 32962 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per Player - Table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.7 by the X% most inactive players. Reading tip 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.
  Show table      % of Players Battles during the update     10% 8   25% 49   50% 232   75% 558   90% 967   100% 32962      Player WR Distribution The graph shows WR distribution for players (y-axis) with during the update 6.7 (x-axis). Only players with more than 100 battles are included.
From the unfiltered WR histogram one can see the bumbs at 0%, 25%, 33%, 50%, 67% 75% and 100% due to large number of of players who played only few battles during the update.

title: Tier VI stats
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought at tier VI during update 6.9.
Battles per Player Number of battles fought per player during the update 6.9.
On average, players played 68 battles. Median was 29 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.9 was 3350 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.

title: Tier VI Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.0 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier VI Tanks

  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.10 only. The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier VI Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.2 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier VI Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.3 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier VI Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.6 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier VI Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.7 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Update 6.6
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought during 6.6. All the stats (WR, damage, battles, etc.) refer to stats during the update, not cumululative/total/lifetime stats unless otherwise mentioned. In total, there were 121576864 battles recorded by 304218 players.
Battles per Player The graph shows the number of battles fought per player during the update 6.6. On average, players played 400 battles. Median was 260 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.6 was 62161 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per Player - Table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.6 by the X% most inactive players. Reading tip 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.

From the unfiltered WR histogram one can see the bumbs at 0%, 25%, 33%, 50%, 67% 75% and 100% due to large number of of players who played only few battles during the update.

title: Tier V Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.0 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier V Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.1 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier V Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.2 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks.   Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.4 only. The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. title: Tier V Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.6 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier V Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.8 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Update 6.5
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought during 6.5. All the stats (WR, damage, battles, etc.) refer to stats during the update, not cumululative/total/lifetime stats unless otherwise mentioned. In total, there were 72904785 battles recorded by 260865 players.
Battles per Player The graph shows the number of battles fought per player during the update 6.5. On average, players played 279 battles. Median was 161 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.5 was 45570 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per Player - Table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.5 by the X% most inactive players. Reading tip 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.
  Show table      % of Players Battles during the update     10% 7   25% 36   50% 161   75% 389   90% 674   100% 45570      Player WR Distribution The graph shows WR distribution for players (y-axis) with during the update 6.5 (x-axis). Only players with more than 100 battles are included.
From the unfiltered WR histogram one can see the bumbs at 0%, 25%, 33%, 50%, 67% 75% and 100% due to large number of of players who played only few battles during the update.

More Statistics by Tier here.
Players by Region This graphs shows players by region in the dataset who have played at least one game. More Statistics by region here. Please note, this does not mean all the players per server, but just those who have been recorded in the BlitzAnalysiz database.

title: Tier IV Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.0 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier IV Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.10 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier IV Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.2 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks.   Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.4 only. The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier IV Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.5 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier IV Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.6 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier IV Tanks

  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.8 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier IV Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.9 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Update 6.4
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought during 6.4. All the stats (WR, damage, battles, etc.) refer to stats during the update, not cumululative/total/lifetime stats unless otherwise mentioned. In total, there were 87183548 battles recorded by 266703 players.
Battles per Player The graph shows the number of battles fought per player during the update 6.4. On average, players played 327 battles. Median was 184 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.4 was 77459 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per Player - Table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.4 by the X% most inactive players. Reading tip 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.
  Show table      % of Players Battles during the update     10% 7   25% 40   50% 184   75% 456   90% 797   100% 77459      Player WR Distribution The graph shows WR distribution for players (y-axis) with during the update 6.4 (x-axis). Only players with more than 100 battles are included.
From the unfiltered WR histogram one can see the bumbs at 0%, 25%, 33%, 50%, 67% 75% and 100% due to large number of of players who played only few battles during the update.

More Statistics by Tier here.
Players by Region This graphs shows players by region in the dataset who have played at least one game. More Statistics by region here. Please note, this does not mean all the players per server, but just those who have been recorded in the BlitzAnalysiz database.

Only tanks with more than 50 players are listed. This may filter out few upcoming tanks that are being tested. More Tank Statistics here.

title: Tier III Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.0 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier III Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.1 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier III Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.10 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. title: Tier III Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.4 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier III Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.5 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Tier III Tanks
content:
The Best Performing Tanks Relative WR The graph shows the tanks the players win the most compared to their average WR at the tier. The measure is called Relative WR and it is a measure of the performance/strength of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.8 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 0-152 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank in the end of the update are included to eliminate the impact of the first battles in the tank (with sub-100% crew / modules). The players need to have 10-20 battles in a tank and 20-40 battles at the tier during the update. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR at Tier is the average WR of the players of the tank at the tier. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks.
